intro: Tritomopterys mollis, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Tritomopterys mollis is often found in moist, shaded areas and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
